intro: Zehneria neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia zehneria, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. Zehneria neocaledonica is often found in humid, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of its native habitat.
